question.body: Recently, reports in the United States and Europe have shown vitamin D deficiencies and rickets-like symptoms in children. Why?

multiple_choice.choice: too much time indoors and strong sunscreen

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although this is a problem in the U.S. and Europe, poor nutrition here generally leads to children being overweight.
Incorrect. Exercise is good for bone and muscle health; however, this would not cause rickets.

Correct. Too much time inside and constantly wearing SPF 100 sunscreen can cause a vitamin D deficiency; sunscreen is very useful in preventing skin damage and skin cancer, but too much of anything is not good.
Incorrect. There is no link between childhood vaccinations and any disorder or disease.

part.hint: Vitamin D is synthesized by the skin when it is exposed to UV light, and a small amount is provided through diet.
